intro: Helianthella californica, commonly known as the California goldfields, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb with yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The species is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its bright, sun-like appearance.
